title: 113_hr3881
content: The Act titled "Expansion of National Security Agency Oversight Act" includes provisions for additional committees to be included in certain reports under the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978. The Act "Expansion of National Security Agency Oversight Act" amends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to include additional congressional committees for oversight. The Act "Expansion of National Security Agency Oversight Act" expands oversight of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to include additional congressional committees. It amends sections related to reports and definitions, specifying the term "appropriate congressional committees" and updating reporting requirements. The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 is amended to include additional congressional committees for oversight. The reporting requirements are updated to refer to the "appropriate congressional committees" instead of specific ones. The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 is amended to include additional congressional committees for oversight, replacing specific committees with the term "appropriate congressional committees." The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 is amended to include additional congressional committees for oversight, replacing specific committees with the term "appropriate congressional committees." The term "committees" is defined in section 301. The Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 is amended to include additional oversight procedures for certain persons outside the United States, with definitions being updated in section 701(b) of the Act. The term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined in section 301. Section 707(a) of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 is amended to refer to "the appropriate congressional committees" for reports.
